intro: Hoya uncinata, commonly known as the curly hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant is a trailing vine that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular among indoor gardeners for its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements. Hoya uncinata is also noted for its ability to produce fragrant blooms, adding a pleasant aroma to its surroundings.
